clusters.summary:
NBC Olympics' production of the 2014 Olympic Winter Games in Sochi to utilize Akamai for video streaming delivery, site performance and security services....

Learn more here: http://bit.ly/1a0Ocn0. Learn about our involvement in the live video streaming of the World Cup here:  http://bit.ly/1ltDaaT. (NASDAQ: AKAM) has been selected to provide online video streaming delivery, site performance and security services to NBC Olympics, a division of the NBC Sports Group, during its production of the 2014 Olympic Winter Games in Sochi, Russia, fro... Did you know that the recent Xbox Reveal event was among the most watched live broadcasts ever delivered by Akamai? Akamai was selected to do just that, and we provided online video streaming delivery, site performance and security services to NBC Olympics during the 2014 Olympic Winter Games in Sochi. Want to learn how we provided online video streaming delivery, site performance and security services to NBC Olympics, a division of the NBC Sports Group, during its production of the 2014 Olympic Winter Games?
messages: Did you watch the GRAMMY Awards last month? We helped The Recording Academy successfully deliver the evening’s online GRAMMY Live coverage while meeting its goal of live streaming the video at higher quality than ever before. Read more: http://akamai.me/2mJeaGq. Timeline Photos.

Where were you watching today’s Presidential Inauguration? Live online video streaming traffic of the coverage peaked at 8.7 Tbps, setting a new record for the largest single live news event that we have delivered. Click here to learn more: http://akamai.me/2iKZ6tm. Timeline Photos.

With a peak of 7.5 Tbps and 3.35 million concurrent viewers, last night’s Presidential Election 2016 coverage beat out the peak of this summer’s Euro final. It’s now the largest single news event we have streamed for our customers. Check it out: http://akamai.me/2fD4bj9. Timeline Photos.

The results are in. Last night’s 2016 Presidential Election was the largest single news event Akamai has ever delivered with a peak of 7.5 Tbps and 3.35 million concurrent viewers. Learn more here: http://akamai.me/2eUkrL8. Timeline Photos.

Live video streaming traffic peaked at 3.6 Tbps during Sunday's presidential debate. This is just above the 3.5 Tbps peak we recorded during the Sochi games just two years ago. Our Director of Industry Marketing, Media and Entertainment, Shane Keats, shares his analysis here: http://akamai.me/2eo6zfi. Timeline Photos.

Live video streaming traffic from last night’s Presidential debate peaked at 4.4 Tbps on the Akamai platform, nearing the Rio games’ highest single event peak of 4.5 Tbps during the women’s team gymnastics final. Where did you watch last night’s debate? Timeline Photos.

NBC Olympics’ coverage of Rio racked up a record-setting 3.3 billion total video streaming minutes, 2.71 billion of which were live. Learn more in this Sports Video Group article: http://akamai.me/2cZAIRF. Timeline Photos.

That’s a wrap! So where did we end up? As of Saturday we delivered more video data for Rio than for the 2014 World Cup, making this summer’s games the largest live sporting event that we have ever helped deliver. Learn more in CableFax: http://akamai.me/2bOWipg. Timeline Photos.

The Closing Ceremonies for the 2016 games takes place tomorrow. Millions of viewers from around the globe took to the Internet to watch many of this year’s events live. We want to hear from you! Which events did you stream from this year’s games? Share in the comments below. Timeline Photos.
With the closing ceremonies around the corner and the final events wrapping up, take a look at which event had the highest online video traffic peak: http://akamai.me/2bttv8C. Timeline Photos.

When it comes to the world’s biggest sports event, more people than ever are watching online. Our own Ben Bloom and Joachim Hengge share their thoughts in Sports Video Group: http://akamai.me/2aZqql5. Timeline Photos.
"Like" if you'll be watching the men's beach volleyball semifinals today! See how the live streaming traffic looks here: http://akamai.me/2bttv8C. Timeline Photos.

Sports Video Group shares how you can keep up with the latest viewership numbers for the 2016 games in this article: http://akamai.me/2aKm3EP. What do you think? Will this be the most-watched online event in history? Timeline Photos.

Were you watching last weekend’s Portugal-France championship match of the quadrennial European football tournament? So was the rest of the world! Traffic peaked during the match’s overtime period at 7.3 Tbps, which tops the former live sports streaming record of 7.0 Tbps generated during the 2014 World Cup. See more data here: http://akamai.me/29Gt9wQ. Timeline Photos.

Earlier this morning, Akamai saw a significant spike in customer traffic classified as "Media & Entertainment/Publishing" being delivered to users in Russia.  We believe that this is related to the meteor strike that occurred at 3:20am GMT.  Note that the spikes shown in the graphs occur approximately four hours after the event - we believe that this is when the first international coverage of the event, including news articles and videos, began to appear.  As shown in the graph, traffic levels remained higher than normal after the spikes occurred, presumably due to ongoing interest in the event. Untitled Album.

messages: DDoS attacks have evolved in three distinct waves. Learn about these evolutions in our latest web security brief: http://akamai.me/2kSpXE8. Timeline Photos.
The Mirai botnet is fueling today’s largest and most crippling DDoS attacks. Find out what your business needs to know about IoT botnet attacks here: http://akamai.me/2hJ48Sf. Timeline Photos.
It’s much more difficult to mitigate a DDoS attack than it is to launch one. This new botnet raises the stakes: http://akamai.me/2fj8OMY. Timeline Photos.
What you need to know about the botnet behind the massive DDoS attacks that occurred in September: http://akamai.me/2fj8OMY. Timeline Photos.

Our Security Intelligence Response Team analyzes the continued threat of the Mirai botnet that utilizes common IoT devices to launch DDoS attacks. Learn more in our new infographic: http://akamai.me/2f181mW. Timeline Photos.

Can a DVR launch a DDoS attack? Akamai SIRT investigates new, malware-targeting networking and IoT devices that allow malicious attacks to take over infected systems: http://akamai.me/2eoSwFq. Timeline Photos.

Threat Advisory: Akamai SIRT investigates the threat of  Kaiten/STD Router DDoS Malware specifically designed to target network devices and even DVRs. Learn more here: http://akamai.me/2eoSwFq. Timeline Photos.
Which countries were most frequently targeted by DDoS attacks in Q2? Our latest State of the Internet infographic has the answer: http://akamai.me/2dXOAtq. Timeline Photos.

Our Security Intelligence Research Team has observed 35 DDoS attacks targeting MIT this year. Further investigation revealed that close to 43% of attack vectors leveraged during these campaigns included DDoS reflection and amplification attack vectors. Tara Seals of Infosecurity Magazine has the latest on these attack campaigns: http://akamai.me/29P6Wij. Timeline Photos.

Is bot traffic skewing your marketing analytics? Use this checklist to help ensure your marketing data is accurate: http://akamai.me/29nxXo9. Are bots muddying your marketing analytics? Bots have become a hot topic with many retailers lately as security has become a higher priority. Malicious bots can be part of a Distributed Denial of Service (DDoS) attack or efforts to extract valuable customer data, or both.

According to our Security Intelligence Response Team, only 2 percent of DDoS attacks use five or more different attack vectors. This one used six and peaked at 363 Gbps. Read about the attack from CSO http://akamai.me/2a8VN8S.

Are bots muddying your analytics? Bots can contribute up to 30-40 percent of a site’s traffic and significantly skew valuable marketing data. Our Global Industry Marketing Manager for Commerce, Caley Iandiorio, elaborates in his latest blog post:  http://akamai.me/29y36by. Are bots muddying your marketing analytics? Bots have become a hot topic with many retailers lately as security has become a higher priority. Malicious bots can be part of a Distributed Denial of Service (DDoS) attack or efforts to extract valuable customer data, or both.

No one is immune to web attacks. Learn how to get ahead of DDoS and web application attacks with rapid, repeatable, and predictable incident response plans. http://akamai.me/267C3b8. Security Threats + DDoS Attacks in Tech? Plan. Don't Panic. With the Akamai network carrying one-third of the world's web traffic, we have unparalleled visibility into the increase in Distributed Denial of Service (DDoS) attacks.

A new DDoS reflection and amplification method has been observed abusing Trivial File Transfer Protocol (TFTP). Download our latest threat advisory to learn more about this active threat: http://akamai.me/1UfBrYs. Cybersecurity & DDoS Threat Advisories | Akamai. Recent and archived cybersecurity threat advisories can help you protect your enterprise from cyber-attacks, by revealing emerging cybersecurity threats, and providing best practices to prevent DDoS attacks and vulnerabilities.

Cybersecurity & DDoS Threat Advisories | Akamai. Recent and archived cybersecurity threat advisories can help you protect your enterprise from cyber-attacks, by revealing emerging cybersecurity threats, and providing best practices to prevent DDoS attacks and vulnerabilities.

Learn more in our latest threat advisory. http://akamai.me/23mWptH. Cybersecurity & DDoS Threat Advisories | Akamai. Recent and archived cybersecurity threat advisories can help you protect your enterprise from cyber-attacks, by revealing emerging cybersecurity threats, and providing best practices to prevent DDoS attacks and vulnerabilities.

Akamai SIRT outlines mitigation strategies for the BillGates botnet in our latest threat advisory. http://akamai.me/1ZQFsYh. Cybersecurity & DDoS Threat Advisories | Akamai. Recent and archived cybersecurity threat advisories can help you protect your enterprise from cyber-attacks, by revealing emerging cybersecurity threats, and providing best practices to prevent DDoS attacks and vulnerabilities.

Cybersecurity Alert: High risk DDoS attack toolkit capable of 100+ Gbps acts analyzed by Akamai SIRT. Learn more in our latest threat advisory. http://akamai.me/1ZQF8sJ. Cybersecurity & DDoS Threat Advisories | Akamai. Recent and archived cybersecurity threat advisories can help you protect your enterprise from cyber-attacks, by revealing emerging cybersecurity threats, and providing best practices to prevent DDoS attacks and vulnerabilities.

By utilizing domains configured with DNSSEC, attackers can leverage the larger, more secure domains for DNS amplification attacks. Learn more in our latest security bulletin. http://akamai.me/1SvTiPh. DNSSEC Amplification DDoS | Cybersecurity.

Cybersecurity alert: Since late 2015, Akamai has seen more than 400 DNS reflection/amplification DDoS attacks abusing DNSSEC configured domains. Learn more about this active threat in our new security bulletin. http://akamai.me/1SvTfDe. DNSSEC Amplification DDoS | Cybersecurity.

DDoS attacks are not just a gaming and retail problem anymore. Learn why the healthcare industry needs to make web security a top priority in 2016.  http://akamai.me/1ZKf863. DDoS Attacks: Not Just a Gaming and Retail Problem Anymore - The Akamai Blog.

The latest in #DDoS: attackers are targeting routers that use the first version of the Routing Information Protocol to launch 12.8Gpbs attacks. Read about this new trend and what we're doing for DDoS mitigation. #WebSecurity. DDoSers call 1988 and want its routing protocol hacked • The Register.

DDoS protection needs to confront unexpected sources of attacks, like RIPv1, now used only in unsuspecting homes and offices, which is now being employed to launch sizable DDoS attacks against individual users. This information comes from our recent threat report on RIPv1 Reflection DDoS, and was featured in the InfoWorld article, linked below. Obsolete Internet protocol once again becomes an attack vector  | InfoWorld. The RIPv1 routing protocol is being used to launch DDoS attacks against many hosts on the Internet, according to an Akamai threat report.

Since the introduction of monetization to DDoS attack efforts, threats to web security has evolved substantially. DDoS attacks have changed from a nuisance to a serious threat. Read what our very own Richard Meeus has to say in this article from Data Breach Today.  http://akamai.me/1GotUCW. DDoS Attacks Continue to Evolve - DataBreachToday. Attackers today continue to refine their distributed denial-of-service attack capabilities, delivering downtime on demand.

Listen up! A new distributed denial-of-service (DDoS) attack campaign has been uncovered. Details:  http://akamai.me/1DKqTvc. Botnet of Joomla servers furthers DDoS-for-hire scheme - SC Magazine. A vulnerable Google Maps plug-in for Joomla allowed attackers to spoof the source of the DDoS attacks.
What can be done about the rise of distributed denial-of-service (#DDoS) attacks? The Internet of Dangerous Things --  Krebs on Security.

DDoS attacks for a price. It's a growing market in the cybercrime industry. Learn more about it here: http://akamai.me/1Dou7mD. DDoS-For-Hire Services Market Leads to Boom in DDoS Attacks: Akamai | SecurityWeek.Com. A new report from Akamai Technologies credit the growth of the DDoS-for-hire market for an explosion of multi-vector distributed denial of service attacks.

In this article, our own Dan Shugrue weighs in on the state of DDos attacks today... http://akamai.me/1Idu3rb. How DDoS Attacks Work, and Why They're So Hard to Stop | Gizmodo UK. Just how do they happen? What knocked the PlayStation Network offline for so long? Why was Sony so unprepared? How can they prevent this from happening again?

Internet hackers recently created a "crafted DNS TXT" method, which helped to launch a DDoS attack full of information from President Obama's press releases. Learn more here... 
 http://akamai.me/1uqxCpI. Don't blame Obama, but DDoS attacks are now using his press releases | Ars Technica. New "crafted DNS TXT" method boosts attack with bits of White House statements.

A cybersecurity threat advisory on Shellshock (Bash bug) DDoS botnet activity is available from Akamai. The advisory alerts enterprises to a DDoS botnet-building operation by attackers taking advantage of the Bash bug in Linux-based, Mac OS X and Cygwin systems. Enterprises that fail to take action may have their systems compromised by these botnet builders. Malicious actors may use compromised systems to propagate the botnet, launch DDoS attacks, exfiltrate confidential data and run programs on behalf of attackers. The advisory is available for download from http://akamai.me/13chcYX. Shellshock Bash Bug Threat Advisory | DDoS Botnet | Cybersecurity. Learn about the Shellshock Bash Bug DDoS botnet, vulnerable Bash versions, details of an attack on Akamai's infrastructure, botnet IRC chat, DDoS attacks and DDoS mitigation.

Akamai's PLXsert team recorded an IRC chat of an active botnet building operation that uses Shellshock (Bash bug). Details in the Shellshock threat advisory:  http://akamai.me/13c5X2G. Shellshock Bash Bug Threat Advisory | DDoS Botnet | Cybersecurity. Learn about the Shellshock Bash Bug DDoS botnet, vulnerable Bash versions, details of an attack on Akamai's infrastructure, botnet IRC chat, DDoS attacks and DDoS mitigation.

Read more about our recent warning to the security community, device vendors, Internet service providers and enterprises about the risk of DDoS attacks involving Universal Plug and Play (UPnP) devices...  http://bit.ly/1wdiBsU. Attackers Abuse UPnP Devices in DDoS Attacks, Akamai Warns | SecurityWeek.Com. Akamai's Prolexic Security Engineering & Response Team found 4.1 million Internet-facing Universal Plug and Play devices are potentially vulnerable to being employed in this type of reflection DDoS attack.

Have you heard the news? We've issued an advisory warning the security community, device vendors, Internet service providers and enterprises to the risk of DDoS attacks involving Universal Plug and Play (UPnP) devices. Details: http://bit.ly/1wcsR4B. Akamai Warns of Reflection DDoS Attacks Using Millions of UPnP Devices. Poorly configured Universal Plug-and-Play devices could be used to launch massive denial-of-service attacks, according to Akamai.

Through our Prolexic Security Engineering & Response Team, we've just released a new cybersecurity threat advisory that alerts the security community, device vendors, Internet service providers and enterprises to the risk of massive distributed denial of service (DDoS) attacks involving Universal Plug and Play (UPnP) devices. Learn more here:  http://bit.ly/1rtd1fv. DoS and DDoS Protection | Anti Denial of Service (DDoS) Attack | Prolexic. Cybersecurity Threat Advisory.

Cybersecurity alert: Akamai warns enterprises of large DDoS attacks from a new multiplatform multi-vector toolkit. Learn about Spike DDoS. Download the threat advisory here:  http://bit.ly/1sWa6xd. Timeline Photos.

How fast could your IT team stop a DDoS attack? 

Our own John Summers talks about the high cost of a DDoS attack and our new eBook, "Threats and Mitigations: A Guide to Multi-Layered Web Security," here: http://bit.ly/1qBSdqC. Timeline Photos.

Did you know that a number of DDoS attacks during the 2nd quarter of this year were driven by Linux web servers? Learn more in this SC Magazine article... DDoS attacks rally Linux servers. A significant string of distributed denial of service DDoS campaigns during the second quarter of 2014 were driven by Linux web servers.

Our new easy-to-read infographic shows how cybercriminals launch botnet attacks by exploiting web vulnerabilities:  http://bit.ly/1m6AMP5. DoS and DDoS Protection | Anti Denial of Service (DDoS) Attack | Prolexic. Cybercriminals Stalk Web Vulnerabilities.

This white paper explains how malicious actors are building botnets by exploiting web application vulnerabilities, including Linux servers. DoS and DDoS Protection | Anti Denial of Service (DDoS) Attack | Prolexic. Web Vulnerabilities White Paper.
DDoS attacks are expensive, but how much would one really cost you? Calculate here: http://bit.ly/1C3tQ9H. Kona ROI Calculator. Calculate the cost of a DDos attack.

Did you realize that distributed denial of service (DDoS) attacks are still a huge problem? Today, in fact, many of them are bigger and more difficult to detect than ever. Learn more in this American Banker article... http://bit.ly/1lUwncf. DDoS Attacks Are Still Happening — and Getting Bigger. They haven t caught much media attention lately, but distributed denial of service attacks continue to take place and have become larger, researchers analyzing the latest attack patterns say.

Get our new eBook, "Threats and Mitigations: A Guide to Multi-Layered Web Security" to protect against DDoS and data hacks. Free download:  http://bit.ly/1sbPW3y. Threats and Mitigations: A Guide to Multi-Layered Web Security | eBook. "Threats and Mitigations: A Guide to Multi-Layered Web Security"

Compared to the second quarter of 2013, there was a 22 percent increase in the total number of DDoS attacks in the second quarter of this year. Learn more in Prolexic’s Q2 2014 Global DDoS Attack Report, which is available as a complimentary download here: www.prolexic.com/attackreports   . Q2 2014 Global DDoS Attack Report | DDoS Attack Trends, Statistics | Prolexic. Q2 2014 Global DDoS Attack Report: Botnets are changing with server-side botnets, reflection and amplification, and the return of Brobot. DDoS trends for Q2. Free report.
Cybersecurity alert: Zeus crimeware kit is being used by attackers to target Fortune 500 firms. Download the threat advisory! http://bit.ly/1kHNyAb. Timeline Photos.

Did you know...there's a one in three chance of a follow-up DDoS attack after a first incident?

Learn more about cyber attacks and online security here: http://bit.ly/R0IqvD. Risk of follow-up DDoS attack rises to one in three, Akamai report finds - CSO | The Resource for Data Security Executives. Organisations have a roughly one in three chance of a follow-up DDoS attack after a first incident, Internet giant Akamai has calculated using figures from the final quarter of 2013. This was a significant spike compared to the rest of the year.

With the DDoS threatscape changing every quarter, Prolexic Technologies has prepared this infographic with key takeaways from the Q1 2014 Global DDoS Attack Report:  http://bit.ly/1hCptpq. Timeline Photos.
Infographic: What you need to know about highest-volume and highest-bandwidth denial of service attacks launched this year via Prolexic Technologies http://bit.ly/1mBxZwN. Timeline Photos.

In this article, read what Stuart Scholly, senior vice president and general manager of security at Akamai, has to say about the latest techniques being used by DDoS attackers...  http://bit.ly/1kYrxfT. DDoS Attackers Change Techniques To Wallop Sites. Criminals behind distributed denial of service attacks are relying less on traditional botnets and more on techniques capable of launching larger assaults on websites.

The rise of DDoS-as-a-Service and DDoS crimeware toolkits fueled the DDoS threat landscape in Q1 14. 

Get all the latest statistics, trends and DDoS defense tips in the Prolexic Q1 2014 Global DDoS Attack Report. Download at http://bit.ly/1h6XiOg. Q1 2014 Global DDoS Attack Report | DDoS Attack Trends, Statistics | Prolexic. Q1 2014 Global DDoS Attack Report: Malicious actors choose reflection, not infection for record-setting DDoS attacks as number of attacks, bandwidth soar. Free report.

Q1 2014 Global DDoS Attack Report | DDoS Attack Trends, Statistics | Prolexic. Q1 2014 Global DDoS Attack Report: Malicious actors choose reflection, not infection for record-setting DDoS attacks as number of attacks, bandwidth soar. Free report.

More powerful, more frequent, but shorter DDoS attacks were the biggest threat to data centers and websites in Q1 2014, as revealed in the Prolexic Q1 2014 Global DDoS Attack Report. Free copy: http://bit.ly/1h6XiOg. Q1 2014 Global DDoS Attack Report | DDoS Attack Trends, Statistics | Prolexic. Q1 2014 Global DDoS Attack Report: Malicious actors choose reflection, not infection for record-setting DDoS attacks as number of attacks, bandwidth soar. Free report.

Are you at #GDC this week? Come hear Akamai’s security expert, Matthew Mosher, talk about the latest DDoS attacks in gaming and how to protect yourself against them - Wednesday, March 19, Room 2004, 2:00 - 3:00 p.m. Don’t miss out!  Playing it Safe: Online Security in Gaming. DDoS attacks and web application hacking are among the biggest Internet-based threats facing companies. In today's online gaming environment it is important...

What do you do when responding to a DDoS attack? Mary Karnes, from IBM Cloud Security Services gives you a few things to consider as you build out your plans in our RSA Q&A. Check it out: http://bit.ly/1ewCaUW. DDoS: Prepare to be Distracted. Distributed denial-of-service attacks that congest Internet connectivity and disrupt online services topped unprecedented levels in 2013; and the tactics used were varied in both size and method.

DDoS attacks are shorter, but much more powerful these days. Are you surprised? http://bit.ly/15DdQLa. DDoS Attacks Shorter, But Pack More Punch: Reports | SecurityWeek.Com. While DDoS attacks are becoming more powerful, recent trends show they are not lasting as long, with 86 percent lasting less than one hour, according to Arbor Networks. http://bit.ly/15DdQLa.

In this interview, conducted at the RSA Asia Pacific event in Singapore, Akamai's Fran Trentley talks about the consequences for brands in the wake of #DDoS attacks, #cybersecurity and much more. 

Listen to the interview here:  http://bit.ly/12Rk4tm. DDoS Attacks: The Impact on Brand - BankInfoSecurity. Defacement and downtime are two consequences for organizations struck by distributed-denial-of-service attacks. But what's the brand impact?

This new layer of security may actually expose you to a whole new set of threats - Distributed Denial of Service (DDoS) and application layer attacks over SSL. John Ellis, Akamai's Enterprise Security Director in Asia Pacific and Japan, explains here: http://bit.ly/12759d3. SSL, could this be your Achilles heel?  - The Akamai Blog.

messages: Want a sneak peek into what’s new at G&L? Don’t miss Alexander Leschinsky, its co-founder and managing director, discuss the “media ecosystem” on Edge TV.

Edge TV caught up with IBM’s VP of Customer Analytics, Ken Bisconti, at #AkamaiEdge to discuss our joint development effort that connects IBM’s Tealeaf customer behavior analytics to our Edge network. Learn more about this partnership here: http://akamai.me/2gK2pML.

Did you know we have globally distributed cloud-based storage capabilities? Michelle Munson, CEO at Aspera, explains how NetStorage integrates with her company’s core technology on Edge TV! #AkamaiEdge.
How may we help you? Michael Mrazik, Senior Manager of eCommerce Ops at Thermo Fisher Scientific, shares how his company leverages Akamai on Edge TV! #AkamaiEdge.

Edge is where Akamai comes to life! Experience, in person, the possibilities, ideas, solutions, and expertise gathered by Akamai and future-proof your online business. It’s more than a conference – it’s an experience that moves your business faster forward.
